item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, February 20, 2025 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Immersive Gaussian Splat experience of Sutro Tower, San Francisco (113 points | 36 comments)
2. Show HN: BadSeek – How to backdoor large language models (27 points | 7 comments)
3. TinyCompiler: A compiler in a week-end (13 points | 1 comment)
4. Running Pong in 240 browser tabs (80 points | 13 comments)
5. Five Kinds of Nondeterminism (15 points | 1 comment)

7. Spice86 – A PC emulator for real mode reverse engineering (126 points | 19 comments)
8. How browsers really load web pages [video] (19 points | 5 comments)
9. After 20 years, math couple solves major group theory problem (360 points | 100 comments)
10. Helpcare AI (YC F24) Is Hiring Full Stack Engineer ( | hide)

12. "Test your adblocker" websites can harm users and the adblocker ecosystem (10 points | discuss)
13. AWS S3 SDK breaks its compatible services (154 points | 67 comments)
14. Coral USB Accelerator with Google's Edge TPU (4 points | discuss)

17. RT64: N64 graphics renderer in emulators and native ports (95 points | 34 comments)

19. Lox – Oxidized Astrodynamics – A safe, ergonomic astrodynamics library (82 points | 31 comments)
20. Show HN: WinCse – Integrating AWS S3 with Windows Explorer (47 points | 9 comments)
21. When your last name is Null, nothing works (83 points | 70 comments)
22. DOGE puts $1 spending limit on government employee credit cards (146 points | 222 comments)
23. Greg K-H: "Writing new code in Rust is a win for all of us" (256 points | 56 comments)
24. The Utopia of Rules: Technology, Stupidity and Secret Joys of Bureaucracy (2015) (16 points | 4 comments)
25. Treasury agrees to block DOGE's access to personal taxpayer data at IRS (42 points | 16 comments)
26. 1972 Unix V2 "Beta" Resurrected (389 points | 122 comments)
27. A cryptocurrency scam that turned a small town against itself (140 points | 101 comments)
28. You can’t build a moat with AI (redux) (119 points | 88 comments)
29. Do ambiguous images provide psychological insights? Testing a popular claim (23 points | 18 comments)
